title.value: Guiding Language Model Math Reasoning with Planning Tokens
title.justification: It's the exact title listed at the beginning of the provided text.
title.quote: Guiding Language Model Math Reasoning with Planning Tokens

extractions.description: The paper introduces a method to guide large language model (LLM) reasoning, particularly for math problems, using planning tokens. These tokens are embedded within the model to guide its reasoning steps, thereby increasing its reasoning capabilities without significantly increasing the number of parameters. Experiments on various math datasets show improved accuracy over standard fine-tuning methods.

type.justification: The paper includes empirical experiments to demonstrate performance improvements on specific datasets.
type.quote: We demonstrate our methodâ€™s effectiveness by applying it to three different LLMs, showing notable accuracy improvements across three math word problem datasets w.r.t. standard fine-tuning baselines.

name.justification: The paper focuses on enhancing the reasoning capabilities of language models, which is a sub-field of Natural Language Processing (NLP).
name.quote: Large language models (LLMs) have recently attracted considerable interest for their ability to perform complex reasoning tasks, such as chain-of-thought reasoning.

name.justification: The paper specifically targets improvements in mathematical reasoning using LLMs.
name.quote: We show a 1.5 gain in average accuracy (4.5 % relative gain)....The experiment results show that by adding planning tokens at training time, we are able to improve upon the baseline without planning tokens by 3.3% accuracy points on average over three pre-trained language models (Phi 1.5 (Gunasekar et al., 2023), 7B Llama 2 (Touvron et al., 2023b), and 13B Llama 2) and three MWP datasets.

name.justification: The paper focuses heavily on improving Chain-of-Thought reasoning in LLMs.
name.quote: A popular and effective paradigm of reasoning with LMs is chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning....We propose to strategically add new tokens into CoTs at training time.

name.justification: Phi-1.5 is mentioned as one of the LMs used in their experiments.
name.quote: We show a 1.5 gain in average accuracy (4.5 % relative gain)....over three pre-trained language models (Phi 1.5, 7B Llama 2, and 13B Llama 2).

is_contributed.justification: The model Phi-1.5 was used for experiments but not introduced as a novel model in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Our empirical analysis uses several decoder-only architectures of varying sizes. We use the 7B and 13B variants of Llama2, both trained over 2 trillion tokens from publicly accessible data sources. We also experiment with Phi-1.5 (Gunasekar et al., 2023), a 1.3B parameter model trained on a mixture of textbook-quality code data, and additional synthetically generated textbook and exercise data.
